content: peppermint candy cane scarf a crochet pattern designed by katie bannon urbandabbler this written pattern and pictures may not be copied shared or sold in full or in part the finished product is yours to do with as you wish including personal use gifting charity and sale if you are selling online please include a link to the pattern on raverly and credit me as the pattern designer i love the look of peppermint candy canes so i decided to design a diagonal scarf that looks like one this scarf is easily adjustable add more chains at the beginning for a wider scarf reduce the number of chains at the beginning for a thinner scarf add row if you would like the scarf to be longer reduce row if you would like the scarf to be shorter this pattern can be a little tricky at first due to the increases and decreases but it s suitable for a beginner crocheter looking for a little challenge peppermint candy cane scarf crochet pattern materials worsted weight yarn to get the peppermint candy cane look you will need one skein of red and one skein of white i used big twist value from joann in colors deep red and white you will need less than one skein of each color 6 mm crochet hook yarn needle to weave in ends stitches and abbreviations used chain chain half_double_crochet half_double_crochet hdc2tog - half_double_crochet 2 together notes chain stitches at the beginning of the row do not count towards the stitch count in each row you will be increasing on one side of the scarf and decreasing on the other side of the scarf because you will be turning at the end of each row you will alternate between starting the row with an increase ending with a decrease and starting the row with a decrease ending with an increase count your stitches periodically as you crochet with the increases and decreases you may accidentally lose or gain a stitch if you aren t careful scarf pattern using red yarn chain 30 or desired width row 1 2 half_double_crochet in third chain from the hook your first increase half_double_crochet across in each chain stitch until two chain stitches remain hdc2tog your first decrease chain 2 turn 28 stitches row 2 hdc2tog this is the decrease half_double_crochet in each stitch across until one stitch remains 2 half_double_crochet in final stitch this is the increase chain 2 turn 28 stitches you should be starting to see the diagonal form now 2 peppermint candy cane scarf crochet pattern row 3 2 half_double_crochet in first stitch half_double_crochet in each stitch until two stitches remain chain 2 turn 28 stitches row 4 -
